adjective.description: Showing willingness to allow the existence of opinions or behavior that one does not necessarily agree with.
examples: we must be tolerant of others
a more tolerant attitude toward other religions

adjective.description: (of a plant, animal, or machine) able to endure specified conditions or treatment.
examples: rye is reasonably tolerant of drought

origin: Late 18th century: from French tolérant, present participle of tolérer, from Latin tolerare (see tolerate). Compare with earlier intolerant.
